website_summaries.verdict: A brilliantly engineered set of three hammers; each has a different weight for versatility and convenience.
pros: Handle and head are encased in a protective "jacket" that helps reduce marring
cons: There may be some industrial-grade applications for which these hammers don't have enough force

customer_reviews.title: Fine for smooth/soft surfaces, but NOT tough or durable
customer_reviews.text: nice hefty dead-blow, but don't bother with it if you plan to use this on masonry/outdoors projects. I bought it specifically for setting/leveling blocks for a wall I'm building and it lasted about 1 day before the hammer surface wore through. Ugh. I like the weight of the hammer, but I guess I'm going to have to drop the money for an eastwing or something else well-made for dealing with coarse masonry surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ellery

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Have these hammers at work and beat the hell out of them with no issues. Bought these for my box at home. First time I used them to beat off a seized brake rotor the rubber on the end tore off. Disappointed but in its defense hitting the edge of a rotor probably would do that to most dead blows.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good Hammers
customer_reviews.text: I have used and even warrantied several other Tekton tools so I was fairly confident these would be of good quality when I placed my order. The hammers are exactly what was expected for a set of dead blows. I haven’t used the smallest one very much but used the larger two to beat off many rusted brake and suspension parts. They never let me down. The plastic covering is holding up and should last for quite a while. Tekton are some of my favorite tools to buy online as they always seem to be decent quality for a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but you can get the same at Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. However it’s nearly identical down to the mold marks as the Harbor Freight tool. These are hammers. While I love Tekton, it’s obvious this hammer comes from the same factory as the cheaper models that do the same thing... hammer. I’m returning my Tekton hammer since the Harbor Freight model is nearly 1/3rd the price.
customer_reviews.author: Han Solo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: My first dead blow hammers. I bought them to install the carrier in the rear end of my Sterling 10.5" rear axle. I didn't know how big of a hammer I would use for the job, and I found this set. Tried all 3, the 3 lb one was the best. If you're doing what I did, and only want to buy 1 hammer, buy the 3 pounder. But I don't regret buying this set.
customer_reviews.author: bigbusyfamily

customer_reviews.title: Good hammers for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, you just need to pound on something to get it to move. A steel hammer will damage the thing, and a rubber mallet will deflect too much. These mallets are just right. Three different sizes, for a price similar to a single deadblow mallet from another maker. There may be applications where these hammers aren't good enough, and the expensive one is the way to go. But I haven't run into any. The plastic seems pretty durable, though not indestructible. I can see some scratching in one of them from the end grain of some wooden pegs I was driving. The plastic also cleans up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Doggerel

customer_reviews.title: Good value on a necessary item
customer_reviews.text: Non-marring on every surface I've struck. Effective no-bounce design. Textured handle provides firm grip. The only reason it's not five stars is the material seems a bit more brittle than that of similar hammers I've owned in the past and I'm unsure of the durability. But for now, they work well. And kudos on the packaging. The OE box and Amazon's box both held up well despite the weight of the hammers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 64-ounce stood up
customer_reviews.text: I installed 75 linear feet of retaining wall block, on a bed of crushed gravel on uneven red clay--tricky install design too. I had to switch the hitting-side toward the completion as the one face of the hammer I used most started to show a bit of wear and bulge. I wasn't easy on the tool and it took the toll. Overall, can't complain. No tools last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A must have for serious shops.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I've never seen anyone use these. But, being familiar with physics and having various trade experience, the idea seemed sound. I've definately found having hammers for each purpose is much better than just grabbing the first one available, so I figured I'd find a purpose for these. Well, I've found many. These really are go-to hammers for many uses. No way I could get away with just these, but I'm very glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Entomy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to install vinyl flooring. Ive been wanting a set of deaf blow hammers for a while. These fit the build. I ended up only using two of the three. I'll find a use for the third eventually! Much better than the rubber hammer I previously used. Highly recommend these after installing 500' of flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Walker

customer_reviews.title: These are truly dead!
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot to go on about! These hammers are exactly as advertised. They have great heft, the handles are able to be gripped easily, and the dead blow function is just that, DEAD! These are quality hammers that will last for a long time if treated properly, i.e., not hitting them on sharp objects. I use these hammers to seat blanks for machining into milling vises, and they work great for that purpose without marring the surface finish of the items.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy one of these sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best freggin hammer! I wish I would have bought one years ago. I was trying to bust a rusted but loose by pounding on the wrench and this thing worked perfect. A few easy taps with this hammer and it broke loose and didn’t leave a mark on the wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine unless you plan to use it as a sledgehammer.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these hammers for a number of automotive projects. These hammers give you a nice sharp smack with great results. These are covered in a soft material that could easily be damaged if you were to hit a pointy or sharp surface. Mine are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product that is holding up well! Update: Taking a star. :( Still happy with this product but I have had it under a month (20 days) and I've got a semicircle that's starting to break away where the hammer is. I do use this hammer 5 days a week. FYI
customer_reviews.author: A3FtCentipede

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for auto work
customer_reviews.text: I have used these extensively around my cars and home. The chance I would have busted something with a regular hammer makes these worth the buy alone, but these have helped me work more efficiently around every material without fear of breaking or cracking
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brezicky

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of hammers
customer_reviews.text: These dead blow hammers work as expected and seem well made. A good quality set that I am glad to have in my tool collection. I'm happy with them and I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger dead blow hammer and this set came with the 48 oz hammer I needed. Even better, it came with the 16 and 32 oz ones as well. All for an excellent price. I use dead blow hammers almost every day as an industrial maintenance mechanic and so far they've held up admirably.
customer_reviews.author: James O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - used them in 2 different situations, 1 to knock in a center pin on a rear differential (smallest hammer) - 1 well placed blow and the pin set, the second time (largest hammer) on a rear rotor that was stuck - hit the rotor pretty hard (alternating between left and right side of the rotor, multiple strikes) with no damage to it and it aligned properly with no damage to the tool.
customer_reviews.author: JSS16

customer_reviews.title: Good value in package
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to get a few dead blows in my tool box and finally decided on these. Used the 48oz one to set a few blocks in a patio project I started. Dead blow was a must for that. These held up very well, surprisingly since the face of the blocks were really rough! Good grip and the flare at the bottom helps to prevent slipping off. Hopefully these will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not very tough
customer_reviews.text: After several moderate uses, the faces of the hammer are coming apart and the metal underneath is exposed...I would consider these very light duty.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Great set and super price
customer_reviews.text: Great set and super price. I work in a factory and we use this exact same hammer. They take a lot of abuse and hold up well. Like any dead blow you will get wear in the plastic and if you hit a sharp ended object you can crack the case beyond repair. I see the abuse they take and for the price range you can not find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: dsmithjr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set. Hubby needed two out of the sizes... Cost was more effective with buying the 3 pc set. Hubby is in the glazier trade profession and these are holding up very well. Worth getting
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff for the price. For daily use I'd get the Trusty Cooks but I'm not an auto guy. I use this for metal fabrication so no hard beating all day. Tekton is a great company.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great hammers, good for smashing things and not leaving marks.
customer_reviews.text: Great hammers, good for smashing things and not leaving marks. I had been using an old crappy rubber mallet that would leave black streaks on everything. I dont know why I waited so long to get these.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen James Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting deadblow
customer_reviews.text: Bought more than a year ago and still running good. I bought it replacing a harbor freight one that lasted 2 months. And yes it gets abused at my work. I'm a fabricator/welder and I hit heavy steel and aluminum all day with it
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: I never had a dead blow hammer per say, ...
customer_reviews.text: I never had a dead blow hammer per say, always used a rubber mallet or a piece of wood a a regular hammer, first time that i used this hammer it was a whole new ball game. Should of bought one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Creasy

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Seems lighter than 4lbs. Definately less shot inside than snapon. Hope it will suffice to remove the stubborn wheels off my pickup..
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with a good set of deadblow hammers. The plastic is soft so if you don't want the ends to get chewed up, don't hit sharp things, but for helping persuade parts into place for gunsmithing and car repair, they work fine!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It’s a dead blow
customer_reviews.text: It’s a dead blow and it does its job. Feels durable and well made
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good low blow
customer_reviews.text: Holding up well and working well on a every day uses.
customer_reviews.author: MR J

customer_reviews.title: Great product in a timely manner with poor attention to detail.
customer_reviews.text: I have just received my hammers today and they seem very nice. However I come to notice on the 48 oz. one of the plugs on the upper portion of the handle was missing upon arrival. This is the reason I didn't give 5 stars. I would like to exchange just the one not all three and I didn't see an option to do such a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Recommend, better quality than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a different brand had lost. This mallet surprised me on how well made it is for the price. Very tough head material when compared to my others. The best thing is the floating (moving) plug weight in head. Less swing needed, and great vibration control to hand.
customer_reviews.author: Proshow

customer_reviews.title: Strong deadblow
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm to get off rusted rims from the rotor without damaging them
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: so they stop nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Short term ownership review - Plastic buttons fell out of the handles, but they won't cause any functional changes. Otherwise they work well, not overfilled with shot, so they stop nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Webic

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great if you’re aware of the correct use of a dead blow they’re great for the times you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer, Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: The hammer is great, but can wear out with excessive use. So 4* for the Hammer, though I consider it a mallet. The additional star is for Teckton. They have wonderful customer service! Remember, contact THEM and not Amazon if you have any issues or questions. support@tekton.com
customer_reviews.author: Fiction Fan

customer_reviews.title: rubber like face, but this is polyurethane and is harder
customer_reviews.text: I use a mallet for stair and trim work to position tight fitting parts. My previous mallet had a softer, rubber like face, but this is polyurethane and is harder. It left marks on the wood that had to be sanded out.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Amazing Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great Deadblow for a fraction of the cost of others!
customer_reviews.author: J-Breeze

customer_reviews.title: Hammer of Thor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dead blow hammer. I used it with pro-claw nail puller while replacing decking boards. It worked amazingly well. It’s very durable and stands up to a lot of heavy hitting.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: A good dead blow hammer
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of small soft face hammers but this is the first dead-blow and I have found it as adequate and will probably get a bigger, heavier one at some point. Seems that if I had just one, a 16 oz. is the size to get unless you want to do some big beating. So I am happy
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This hammer gets the job done, but the rubber is rather hard and the squared edges can be slightly uncomfortable over a period of time. It will get the job done without leaving marks and there is very little rebound after the strike.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Work
customer_reviews.text: Work good. But inshouldnhave spend the money and got the 8lbs It's still good.just being cheap
customer_reviews.author: Michael iron86 T

customer_reviews.title: very happy with these have come in handy at
customer_reviews.text: use them every day. why pay 100 bucks for the snap on version when you can pay 30 bucks. Its a simple tool it doesnt need to be expensive and they work the same as stuff 4x the price of them. very happy with these have come in handy at work
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good Dead Blow Hammer
customer_reviews.text: They've taken some abuse the last few months but one of them has cracked. Might be my fault for hitting a narrow edge but I figured it would hold up better. Still recommended because if used correctly as a dead-blow hammer rather than a regular hammer, they will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Good one.
customer_reviews.text: Good one. Price and performance are good as long as you use it for intended purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Kilo711

customer_reviews.title: Wore out much quicker than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I used this hammer on my paver walkway to level out the bricks for about two hours. One side of the head is completely worn to the point where material is coming apart. I was not abusing the hammer or using overly aggressive. I thought it would hold up a lot longer than this.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality set . Not made for heavy duty abuse but fine for the average homeowner.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My husband is installing laminate wood flooring and really likes this hammer better than the lighter one in the starter kit we bought initially.

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two days
customer_reviews.text: These were used to set pavers, and all three broke within two days of using them. Unfortunately, they weren't used until the return window was closed.

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap hammer.
customer_reviews.text: I've used and abused this hammer a lot over the last few months. The face does show damage from hitting sharp or pointy things but it seems to have a lot of life left in it. The handle is also comfortable. For the price, I think it's a great buy.

customer_reviews.title: Relatively good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Relatively good quality for the price. Not the same as a Armstrong or other top tier brand but it does the job for a good price.

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I both enjoy using them around the farm
customer_reviews.text: No issues so far. Have used on a variety of projects. My wife and I both enjoy using them around the farm.

customer_reviews.text: Good price, and good design overall. But the seem that runs thru the center of the striking surface is not smooth.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is I wish the largest one was a pound or two heavier.

customer_reviews.text: I use this for jewelry making. It works well. Be careful of your thumb though!

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: First the good: The plastic is high quality and does not seem to mar or smudge what it hits, the balance is acceptable, and the selection is nice. Now the down side: I bought these to complement a dead blow hammer I already owned and I still prefer that hammer. You see that hammer has more free space in the head for the ballast to move when you swing it. In my experience, this ballast/shot moving it what makes these type of hammer so much better than a simple nylon/rubber hammer. And these hammers are just too tight to take full advantage of the effect.
customer_reviews.author: T.G.

customer_reviews.title: Really good set of dead blows for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Really good set of dead blows for a good price. You might not need all the sizes, but if you do, this is a good choice.

product_meta.title: TEKTON 30709 Dead Blow Hammer Set with 16, 32 and 48-Ounce
product_meta.description:
Size:Set

Steel shot inside the head of these specially-designed dead blow hammers eliminates post-strike rebound common with steel and other solid-head hammers. Controlling this rebound conserves the energy of each blow, redirecting it completely into the work piece. This means fewer blows are needed, reducing the chances of deforming the work piece. At the same time, work surfaces are protected by the high-impact poly jacket that completely encases the all-steel head and handle. This jacket gives a positive strike while preventing marring of softer metals like aluminum. The handle is finished with a comfortable diamond tread pattern for a non-slip grip.

Set Includes:

 * (1) 16 oz. dead blow hammer
 * (1) 32 oz. dead blow hammer
 * (1) 48 oz. dead blow hammer
feature_bullets: Steel shot inside head eliminates rebound, conserving energy of each blow
High-impact poly jacket surrounds steel handle and head, preventing marring of surfaces
Diamond textured handle for non-slip grip
